homepage.credo: We don't remember plots — we remember ourselves and how we felt while reading
homepage.firstIntroduction: In a world where we are pushed to count pages read, rate books with stars, and compete in yearly, monthly, and even 24-hour challenges, we choose to pause.
homepage.secondIntroduction: We believe a book is not a unit of information. It is an imprint of who you were at a specific moment in time. The value lies not in quantity, but in the depth of the lived experience.
homepage.ourPhilosophyDescription: This space was created to remove dry statistics and let something personal grow instead. Here, your books don't gather dust in an “Archive” list — they take root in your private garden.
homepage.whyHerbariumDescription: We replaced numbers with living metaphors, so you can feel the real weight of your experience.
homepage.whyHerbariumFirstDescription: A book is not just fantasy or non-fiction. It can be your Anchor, your Turning Point, or your Awakening.
homepage.whyHerbariumSecondDescription: We don't score books. We notice what they left in us.
homepage.whyHerbariumThirdDescription: We don't care how fast you read. We care how deeply you are with yourself in that moment.
homepage.personalLandscapeDescription: This is not a user profile. It is a garden you tend.
homepage.personalLandscapeFirstDescription: Books you've just started, or ideas waiting for their moment.
homepage.personalLandscapeThirdDescription: Texts that changed the way you see the world — for good.
homepage.summary: You don't have to write perfectly here. You don't have to write much. Even one dried petal — a single line of memory — is enough.
